docs.abstract: The Times has covered George Floyd’s death from the beginning. Here are some of our best stories.
docs.snippet: The Times has covered George Floyd’s death from the beginning. Here are some of our best stories.

headline.main: The Times has covered George Floyd’s death from the beginning. Here are some of our most important stories.

docs.abstract: State Senator Zellnor Myrie and Assemblywoman Diana Richardson say they were assaulted and pepper-sprayed by the police during last year’s Black Lives Matter protests.
docs.snippet: State Senator Zellnor Myrie and Assemblywoman Diana Richardson say they were assaulted and pepper-sprayed by the police during last year’s Black Lives Matter protests.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two New York lawmakers who said they were surrounded, beaten with bicycles and pepper-sprayed by the police during a Black Lives Matter protest in Brooklyn last year filed a federal civil-rights lawsuit against the city on Monday, adding to the blizzard of litigation over the Police Department’s conduct during the protests.

headline.main: Lawmakers Sue N.Y.P.D., Saying They Were Beaten With Bicycles at Protest
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers, Who Say Police  Beat Them, Sue the N.Y.P.D.

docs.abstract: Mr. Floyd’s 7-year-old daughter appeared in a video played in court during Derek Chauvin’s sentencing hearing.
docs.snippet: Mr. Floyd’s 7-year-old daughter appeared in a video played in court during Derek Chauvin’s sentencing hearing.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gianna Floyd, the 7-year-old daughter of George Floyd, said in a video played in court on Friday that she missed her father and that she wished she could play with him.

headline.main: ‘I want to play with him,’ Gianna Floyd, George Floyd’s daughter, says in a video.

docs.abstract: Prosecutors had sought 30 years in prison for the former police officer. Mr. Chauvin’s defense team wanted him released immediately.
docs.snippet: Prosecutors had sought 30 years in prison for the former police officer. Mr. Chauvin’s defense team wanted him released immediately.
docs.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — The killing of George Floyd on a Minneapolis corner led to nationwide protests, a reckoning over racial injustice touching on virtually every aspect of American life and, on Friday, a substantial prison sentence — 22 and a half years — for the former police officer, Derek Chauvin, who ignored Mr. Floyd’s desperate cries for help and pressed his knee into Mr. Floyd’s neck for what seemed an eternity.

headline.main: Derek Chauvin is sentenced to 22 and a half years for murder of George Floyd.
headline.print_headline: Chauvin Given 22½-Year Term In Floyd Killing

docs.abstract: The sentence came more than two months after Mr. Chauvin’s trial concluded with a guilty verdict on all three counts. The courtroom drama continued with powerful testimony from both sides.
docs.snippet: The sentence came more than two months after Mr. Chauvin’s trial concluded with a guilty verdict on all three counts. The courtroom drama continued with powerful testimony from both sides.
docs.lead_paragraph: After an extraordinary sequence of emotional testimony in a Minneapolis courtroom on Friday, a judge sentenced Derek Chauvin, a former police officer, to 22 and a half years in prison for murdering George Floyd while on duty by kneeling on his neck for more than nine minutes as he pleaded for air.

headline.main: 5 takeaways from Derek Chauvin’s sentencing for the murder of George Floyd.

docs.abstract: Asked for his reaction to Derek Chauvin being sentenced Friday to 22 and a half years in prison for the murder of George Floyd, President Biden described it as “appropriate.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Asked for his reaction to Derek Chauvin being sentenced Friday to 22 and a half years in prison for the murder of George Floyd, President Biden described it as “appropriate.”

headline.main: Biden calls long prison sentence for Derek Chauvin ‘appropriate.’

docs.abstract: Mr. Chauvin was sentenced to more than 22 years for the murder of George Floyd. Here is the full opinion.
docs.snippet: Mr. Chauvin was sentenced to more than 22 years for the murder of George Floyd. Here is the full opinion.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Chauvin was sentenced to more than 22 years for the murder of George Floyd. Here is the full opinion.

docs.abstract: Judge Peter A. Cahill of Hennepin County District Court sentenced Mr. Chauvin, the former Minneapolis police officer, to 22 and a half years in prison for the murder of George Floyd.
docs.snippet: Judge Peter A. Cahill of Hennepin County District Court sentenced Mr. Chauvin, the former Minneapolis police officer, to 22 and a half years in prison for the murder of George Floyd.
docs.lead_paragraph: Judge Peter A. Cahill of Hennepin County District Court sentenced Mr. Chauvin, the former Minneapolis police officer, to 22 and a half years in prison for the murder of George Floyd.

docs.abstract: Gianna Floyd, 7, said in the video that she missed her father and wished she could play with him again. Derek Chauvin was sentenced on Friday to 22 and a half years in prison for George Floyd’s murder.
docs.snippet: Gianna Floyd, 7, said in the video that she missed her father and wished she could play with him again. Derek Chauvin was sentenced on Friday to 22 and a half years in prison for George Floyd’s murder.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gianna Floyd, 7, said in the video that she missed her father and wished she could play with him again. Derek Chauvin was sentenced on Friday to 22 and a half years in prison for George Floyd’s murder.

headline.main: Video of George Floyd’s Daughter Played at Chauvin Sentencing

docs.abstract: The family of George Floyd said the 22½-year sentence for the former police officer was not long enough but celebrated what they viewed as partial accountability.
docs.snippet: The family of George Floyd said the 22½-year sentence for the former police officer was not long enough but celebrated what they viewed as partial accountability.
docs.lead_paragraph: The family of George Floyd said the 22½-year sentence for the former police officer was not long enough but celebrated what they viewed as partial accountability.

headline.main: Floyd Family Reacts to Derek Chauvin Sentencing
